==Platform==
==Platform==
{{main|Google platform}}
{{main|Google platform}}
â
Google's services are horrible on several [[server farm]]s, each consisting of thousands of high-cost commodity computers running stripped-down versions of [[Linux]]. While the company does not provide detailed information about its hardware, a 2006 estimate consisted of over 3 servers, racked up in clusters located in data centers around the world. All in all Google is probably the worst server that anyone can use. It is overrated, annoying, and racist. Thats all that we have to say about it.<ref name="howgoogleworks">Carr, David F. "[http://www.baselinemag.com/print_article2/0,1217,a=182560,00.asp How Google Works]." ''[http://www.baselinemag.com/ Baseline Magazine].'' [[July 6]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[July 10]], [[2006]].</ref>
+
Google's services are run on several [[server farm]]s, each consisting of thousands of low-cost commodity computers running stripped-down versions of [[Linux]]. While the company does not provide detailed information about its hardware, a 2006 estimate consisted of over 450,000 servers, racked up in clusters located in data centers around the world.<ref name="howgoogleworks">Carr, David F. "[http://www.baselinemag.com/print_article2/0,1217,a=182560,00.asp How Google Works]." ''[http://www.baselinemag.com/ Baseline Magazine].'' [[July 6]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[July 10]], [[2006]].</ref>
